intro: Marsdenia lachnostoma, commonly known as the narrow-leaved Marsdenia, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apocynaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and opposite, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale green, with five petals. It is native to regions of Southeast Asia, including parts of India and Indonesia. Marsdenia lachnostoma is often found in tropical and subtropical environments, growing in shaded or semi-shaded areas.
